Articles.Content:
With the landmarks that I'm flying around to see, is there a mod that patches in buildings?

It feels like I'm just seeing terrain features and what not, but some of the names leave me wondering if there's something I'm missing.

Edited May 5, 2015 by almagnus1
The points that come up in the contract system are procedurally generated and dont actually correspond to visible landmarks.

The points that come up in the contract system are procedurally generated and dont actually correspond to visible landmarks.

I've basically avoided these contracts because the payout is low and they are relatively hard to hit the contract requirements.

IMO, what would make these contracts better is:

(1) spawn parts (or scenery, but i assume thats not possible) and give us an area, not specific locations. This will be more fun since we will have to find the item, and there is something to find.

(2) instead of telling us to do a temperature scan at X location, and awarding 4 science for doing so, why not have the contract scan the science logs (before the contract is spawned), find an experiment that hasnt been done in X location/biome, and tell us to do it? We will then earn science from doing the science, and not from completing the contract. Plus, it is a good way to ensure we get every ounce of science, without having to manually scan the science archives ourselves.

Edited May 5, 2015 by arkie87
